thread.title: Labour's Dugdale says party she leads will never support independence
thread.title_full: Labour's Dugdale says party she leads will never support independence

title: Labour's Dugdale says party she leads will never support independence
text:
Media playback is unsupported on your device Labour's Dugdale says party she leads will never support independence 25 February 2017 Last updated at 17:09 GMT Scottish Labour leader Kezia Dugdale said the party she leads would "never support independence". 
Speaking to delegates gathered in Perth, the MSP insisted: "The Labour Party I lead will never betray its values so easily. 
"It will never turn its back on the idea that together weâ€™re stronger. 
"That we can achieve far more working in partnership than we can alone." 
Ms Dugdale went on to say in her keynote speech: "Conference, the Labour Party I lead will never support independence." Read more
